items.sentence: Did Tom look like he knew what he was doing?
Did Tom look like he was having a good time?
Did Tom try to persuade you to do that, too?
There was nothing Tom could do to stop Mary.
Tom realized he no longer needed to do that.
Tom was shaken by the news of Mary\'s death.
Tom\'s wife told me that he wasn\'t at home.
I don\'t talk with Tom as much as I used to.
I don\'t think I could do what Tom is doing.
We were supposed to leave Boston that night.
It must be very lonely here all by yourself.
Tom didn\'t say who he\'d given his keys to.
You\'re running out of options, aren\'t you?
Tom is the one who usually does the cooking.
Tom is the only one who knows what happened.
I stopped by the supermarket on my way home.
I suppose Tom found what he was looking for.
There aren\'t many trees in my neighborhood.
There aren\'t usually this many people here.
Let\'s hope that that doesn\'t happen again.
